sentences.sentence: By the time that I got out into the grounds Sherlock Holmes was on the roof, and I could see him crawling( 爬 ) very slowly along the ridge( 屋脊 ).
I lost sight of him behind a stack( （整齐的）一堆 ) of chimneys, but he presently reappeared, and then vanished( 消失 ) once more upon the opposite( 相反的 ) side.
When I made my way round there I found him seated at the edge of the roof.
“That you, Watson?” he cried.
“Yes.”
“This is the place. What is that black thing down there?”
“A water-barrel( 桶 ).”
“Is there a cover on it?”
“Yes.”
“No sign of a ladder?”
“No.”
“Damn( 该死的 ) the fellow! It’s a dangerous place. Still, I ought to be able to climb down where he could climb up. The water-pipe feels pretty firm. Here goes, anyhow.”
There was a shuffling( 拖着脚走 ) of feet, and the lantern began to come steadily down the side of the wall.
Then with a light spring he came on to the barrel( 桶 ), and from there to the earth.
“It was easy to follow him,” he said, drawing on his shoes and socks.
“Tiles( 瓦片 ) were loosened the whole way along, and in his hurry he had dropped this. It confirms my diagnosis( 判断 ), as you doctors express it.”
The object which he held up to me was a small bag or pouch( 小袋 ) woven( 编织 ) out of colored grasses and with a few cheap-looking beads( 珠子 ) strung round it.
In shape and size it was not unlike a cigarette-case.
Inside were half a dozen thorns( 刺 ) of dark wood, sharp at one end and rounded at the other, like that which had struck Bartholomew Sholto.
“They are terrible things,” said he. “Look out that you don’t prick( 刺 ) yourself. I’m delighted to have them, for most likely they are all he has.
There is the less fear of you or me finding one in our skin before long. I would sooner( 宁愿 ) face a bullet( 子弹 ), myself. Are you ready for a six-mile walk, Watson?”
“Certainly,” I answered.
“Your leg will be OK?”
“Oh, yes.”
“Here you are, doggy! Good old Toby! Smell it, Toby, smell it!”
He pushed the tarry( 沾了焦油的 ) handkerchief under the dog’s nose,
while the creature stood with its legs separated, and sniffed it with a most comical( 滑稽的 ) movement of its head, like a connoisseur( 鉴赏家 ) sniffing a famous wine.
Holmes then threw the handkerchief to a distance, fastened a rope to the dog’s collar, and led him to the foot of the water-barrel( 桶 ).
The creature instantly broke into a succession( 一连串 ) of high-pitched( 音调高的 ) barks,
and, with his nose on the ground and his tail in the air, ran off upon the trail( 嗅迹 ) at a pace which strained( 拉紧 ) his leash( （牵狗的）皮带 ) and kept us at the top of our speed.
The east had been gradually whitening, and we could now see some distance in the cold gray light.
The square, massive house, with its black, empty windows and high, bare walls, towered up, sad and abandoned, behind us.
Our course led right across the grounds, in and out among the trenches( 沟渠 ) and pits( （尤指在地上挖出的）坑 ) with which they were scarred and intersected( 相交 ).
The whole place, with its scattered( 分散的 ) dirt-heaps and ill-grown bushes, had an unlucky look which harmonized with( 与...协调 ) the black tragedy( 悲剧 ) which hung over it.
On reaching the boundary wall Toby ran along, whining eagerly, underneath its shadow, and stopped finally in a corner hidden by a small tree.
Where the two walls joined, several bricks had been loosened and partly pulled out, as though they had frequently been used as a ladder.
Holmes climbed up, and, taking the dog from me, he dropped it over upon the other side.
“There’s the print of wooden-leg’s hand,” he remarked, as I mounted( 爬上 ) up beside him. “You see the slight mark of blood upon the white plaster( 灰泥 ).
What a lucky thing it is that we have had no rain since yesterday! The scent( 气味 ) will lie upon the road in spite of( 尽管 ) their twenty-eight hours’ start.”
I confess( 坦白 ) that I had my doubts when I reflected on the traffic which had passed along the London road in the interval.
But Toby never hesitated( 犹豫 ) or swerved, but waddled on in his peculiar( 奇怪的 ) rolling fashion( 方式 ).
Clearly, the strong smell of the tar( 焦油 ) rose high above all other competing scents( 气味 ).
“Do not imagine,” said Holmes, “that I depend for my success in this case upon the mere chance of one of these fellows having put his foot in the chemical.
I have knowledge now which would enable( 使能够 ) me to trace( 追踪 ) them in many different ways.
This, however, is the easiest and, since good luck has put it into our hands, I should be much to blame if I neglected( 忽视 ) it.
It has, however, prevented the case from becoming the pretty little intellectual( （需用）智力的 ) problem which it at one time promised to be.
There might have been some credit to be gained out of it, but for( 要不是 ) this too obvious clue( 线索 ).”

“There is credit, and to spare,” said I. “I assure( 向...保证 ) you, Holmes, that I marvel( 钦佩 ) at the means by which you obtain your results in this case, even more than I did in the Jefferson Hope murder.
The thing seems to me to be deeper and more inexplicable( 费解的 ). How, for example, could you describe with such confidence the wooden-legged man?”
“It was simplicity itself.
Two officers who are in command of( 掌管 ) a convict( 囚犯 )-guard learn an important secret about buried treasure.
A map is drawn for them by an Englishman named Jonathan Small.
You remember that we saw the name upon the chart in Captain Morstan’s possession.
He had signed it in behalf of( 代表 ) himself and his associates—the sign of the four, as he somewhat dramatically called it.
Helped by this chart, the officers—or one of them—gets the treasure and brings it to England, leaving, we will suppose, some condition under which he received it unfulfilled( 未兑现的 ).
Now, then, why did not Jonathan Small get the treasure himself? The answer is obvious.
The chart is dated at a time when Morstan was brought into close association with convicts( 囚犯 ).
Jonathan Small did not get the treasure because he and his associates were themselves convicts( 囚犯 ) and could not get away.”
“But that is mere speculation( 猜测 ),” said I.
“It is more than that. It is the only theory which covers the facts. Let us see how it fits in with( 与...一致 ) later events.
Major Sholto remains at peace for some years, happy in the possession of his treasure.
Then he receives a letter from India which gives him a great fright( 惊吓 ). What was that?”
“A letter to say that the men whom he had wronged had been set free.”
“Or had escaped. That is much more likely, for he would have known what their term of imprisonment was.
It would not have been a surprise to him.
What does he do then? He guards himself against a wooden-legged man—a white man, mark you( 你听好了 ), for he mistakes a white tradesman for( 错当成 ) him, and actually fires a gun at him.
Now, only one white man’s name is on the chart. The others are all Indian names.
Therefore we may say with confidence that the wooden-legged man is identical( 同一的 ) with Jonathan Small.
Does the reasoning strike you as being faulty?”
“No: it is clear and concise( 简明的 ).”
